message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. While chronic hypertension and diabetes can increase the risk of early pregnancy loss, advanced maternal age (above 35 years old) is the strongest risk factor. Hypercoagulable state is also associated with miscarriage but is less common than advanced maternal age.
